entry.title: dyld: library not loaded
entry.content:
dyld: Library not loaded: @rpath/SenTestingKit.framework/Versions/A/SenTestingKit Referenced from: /Users/antkong/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/ebookreader-gplhzhssjudwymcrqpmxxokvhqvn/Build/Products/Debug/ebookreader.app/Contents/MacOS/ebookreader Reason: image not found

Is it going to be the answer?

I have found a fix by getting to know what @rpath means. It is a tag placed in the generation of an executable’s binary format indicating alternate paths to look for dependencies (including other libraries). By setting the build option “runpath search paths” to the developer frameworks directory, the executable looks in this place for the sen testing library at run time.

entry.title: OSX terminal and .bashrc
entry.content:
When I create a new tab in Terminal, the new bash shell does not automatically execute the .bashrc file. As a result my brew environmet is not setup propertly.

To solve it, I added this to my .bash_profile to fix the problem:

```

[[ -s ~/.bashrc ]] && source ~/.bashrc

```

-s here means if the file exists and not of size 0

entry.title: NSDocument and First Responder
entry.content:
Trying to understand how NSDocument works with First Responder model in OSX app. This SO articule seems helpful:

Connecting Menu Items in Document Based Applications
